addemoji.description: adds an emoji to this guild

emoji_or_url.description: provide an emoji or a url to a picture.

name.description: the name of the new emoji

limit_to_roles.description: the role(s) that is/are allowed to use the emoji. Separate them with spaces.

addemoji.isGuildEmoji: That emoji is already on this guild!
addemoji.invalidUrl:
The provided argument is not a valid url or emoji!
The url must end with `jpg`, `jpeg`, `png`, `webp`, `svg` or `gif`.
Example: https://www.google.com/images/branding/googlelogo/1x/googlelogo_dark_color_272x92dp.png
addemoji.notFound: The provided url was not found.
addemoji.limitedToRoles:
The emoji has been limited to the following roles:
<@&{roles}>.
addemoji.error:
Unable to create the emoji for reason:
```
{err}
```
addemoji.timedOut: The request timed out. Maybe the image is to large.

json.description: create a button from raw JSON data
JSON data to create a button from

custom.description: create your own button with a bunch of options

style.description: What style should your button have?

emoji.description: The emoji you want to show on the button. Gets overwritten by the "label" option.

label.description: The text you want to show on the button. Overwrites the "emoji" option.

url.description: The url the button points to. Works only with "Link" style option.

new_row.description: Use a new row for the button.

content.description: Set a message to the button message.

message_id.description: The message you want to add a button to. Needs to be in the same channel as the command.

button.msgNotFound: The message id you provided was not found in this channel!
button.botIsNotAuthor: I can only edit my own messages!
button.buttonLimit: A message cannot have more then 5 rows or 25 buttons!
button.success:
Your button has been sent! Below is the button code.
If you want to send it again, use the `json` subcommand.

```json
{json}
```

embed.description: sends a custom embed; you can do newlines with "/n".

custom.description: create your own embed with a bunch of options

description.description: set the embed text, use "/n" for newlines

content.description: set a message outside of the embed

predefined_color.description: Set the embed color from predefined discord codes

custom_color.description: set a custom 6-char HEX Code as embed color (e.g. #ffffff)

json.description: create an embed from raw JSON data
JSON data to create an embed from

embed.success:
Your embed has been sent! Below is the embed code.
If you want to send it again, use the `json` subcommand.

```json
{json}
```

hash.description: encrypts or decrypts your text with various methods

input.description: the text you want to encrypt or decrypt

method.description: with which method your text should get encrypted

lastping.description: Shows you where you got last mentioned.

usage.usage:
{prefix}lastping [#channel]
If the `channel` option is used, a maximum of 200 messages will be searched.

channel.description: The channel you want to look for mentions in. Defaults to the whole guild.

member.description: Search only for mentions by a specific member? (Only in combination with the "channel" option)

lastping.memberRequiresChannel: The "member" option only works in combination with the "channel" option!
lastping.invalid: The selected channel is not a text channel!
lastping.embedDescription:
The last time you were mentioned was [here]({url}) from <@{author}>.
{content}

usage.usage:
{prefix}math [expression]

This calculator supports a wide range of mathematical operations, not just the basic ones.
You can assign values to variables, for example: `x=10`.
Multiple statements can be evaluated by using a new line or a semicolon, for example: `x=10; x+10` will return `20`.
Remember to use an asterisk (`*`) for multiplication.
The calculator can output multiple results.Please note that unnecessary spaces can cause errors in expressions.

expression.description: What do you want me to solve?

math.noInput: You have not given any input!
math.error:
An error occurred while trying to solve your expression:
```{err}```

count.description: How many passwords do you want to generate?

exclude_chars.description: characters you won't have in your password

include_chars.description: characters you want to have in your password, additional to the default charset.

passwordgenerator.charsetEmpty: you excluded all chars of the charset...
passwordgenerator.success:
Your secure password(s):
{passwords}

||Created with the following charset:
```{charset}```
Use the command options to add or remove chars.||

randomnumber.description: Returns a random number. Uses default values for invalid inputs.

minimum.description: The smallest possible number. Defaults to 0.

maximum.description: The largest possible number. Defaults to 100.

record.description: Record a voice channel. Needs approval from users.

channel.description: Wich voice channel do you want to record?

public.description: Make the recording public, so any guild member can hear it.

record.noTarget: There is no one to record! Either all targets are bots or they are not in a voice channel! If you supplied a channel, make sure it is the one the target is in!
record.needVoiceChannel: You need to supply a voice channel or be in one!
record.cannotJoin: I can not join that voice channel! Make sure the channel is not full and I have the needed permissions.
record.deaf: I am currently deafened and i cannot undeaf myself!
record.embedDescription:
<@{user}> wants to record you in voice channel <#{channel}>.
**{publicOrPrivate}**
Please press a button to allow or deny the recording of your voice.
record.isPublic: This recording will be available to every member of the guild.
record.isPrivate: This recording will be only available for the current members of the voice channel that allowed the recording.
record.cantConnect: I could not connect to the voice channel! Please try again.
record.denied: No one wants to get recorded.
record.updated: Your response has been set to `{permission}`. I am waiting for the other members to reply.
record.notFound: Your recording has not been found!
record.privateReady: Press the button to get the recording.

timestamp.description: Get a timestamp for the future (or past by putting a "-" in front)

time.description: The time from now (eg. 1w3d2h5min). Use "/help timestamp" for more Information.

timestamp.invalid: The time you provided is invalid! Use {command} and search for `timestamp` for mor information.
timestamp.outOfRange: The specified time is greater than 200,000 years!
